title: Facilitating Diversity and Accessibility in Microscopy through Educational Initiatives and Streamlined Training Approaches
content: Microscopy, an essential science for research and development in academia and industry, often appears complex and inaccessible, demanding novel methods to clarify its theory and operation for a diverse audience. This study aims to bridge the gap in understanding microscopy across educational levels, enhancing inclusivity and fostering broader participation. Two approaches have been described to enhance microscopy education: interactive modules for K-12 students and streamlined SEM process checklists for higher education students, simplifying complex concepts and techniques from foundational learning to more advanced applications.
